title: Boeing's board in emergency meetings as 737 Max crisis deepens
text:
Senior Boeing executives are due to hold a second day of meetings tomorrow after new messages, published late on Friday, deepened the crisis surrounding the company’s 737 MAX jet.

Boeing’s board of directors and top staff from its commercial airplanes division were due to meet in Texas on Sunday and Monday after a 2016 exchange was released which suggested the company had known about problems with the flight control system years before it became implicated in two fatal crashes.

In the messages, which were between two lead technical pilots on the Boeing 737 Max Program, one complained the system was “running rampant” and difficult to control. “Granted, I suck at flying, but even this was egregious,”...
